intro: Cardamine baishanensis, commonly known as the Bai Shan water shield, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are usually basal, with a distinctive lobed or divided structure. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by supporting local insect populations and contributing to biodiversity.
